result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant in court in custody with attorney Jacob Hilton. ADA Berg appears for the State of Wisconsin. Matter on for STC on this case and SAR on 21CM467. Agreements not reached. Court proceeds with sentencing after revocation filed first. Argument by State. DOC is recommending 3-6 months. State requests 5 months jail with Huber.
305 pm Argument by Atty Hilton and requesting time served
308 pm Defendant makes statement to court. Vitim / family present, do not make statement. Court addresses family as to treatment. Court addresses family as to treatment.

Defendant Michael J Behenna in court, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Hilton in court for Michael J Behenna.  Attorney JJ Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. Victims present. Attorney Hilton brings motion to modify bond. Attorney Crawford objects to modification of bond. No contact can be addressed at the sentencing after revocation hearing. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant in court in custody via video with atty Hilton. ADA Berg appears for the State of Wisconsin. Revocation proceeding on other file just yesterday. Decision from ALJ usually within 10 days. Discovery has been going forward. ADA Berg agrees to wait for revocation decision to be made. Victims present in court and makes statement. Victims inquire on lifting no contact order. Phone contact was allowed at the last hearing. Victims would like contact. Court will not enter any orders today but will address when court knows in custody status. Atty Hilton addresses concern if defendant is released and no contact condition. ADA Berg has concerns with no contact being lifted and placement. Court will set over in 2 weeks to address. Court in recess at 305 pm.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

*AMENDED 9/6/2022: MAY HAVE PHONE CONTACT WITH VICTIM WHILE IN CUSTODY*

Defendant Michael J Behenna in court, in custody by video.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jacob Hilton appeared for defendant. Defendant qualifies for SPD. SPD contacted last week and stated that defendant qualifies. Attorney Hilton states just in the process of being appointed. Victim present and wishes for no contact to be removed. State objects to removal of no contact. Bond amended to phone contact only while in custody. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

**AMENDMENT 10-24-2022- No violent contact with victims. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. MUST FOLLOW THROUGH WITH ALL TREATMENT. MUST FOLLOW ALL HOUSE RULES AND COMPLY.

*AMENDED 9/6/2022: MAY HAVE PHONE CONTACT WITH VICTIM WHILE IN CUSTODY

Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons, including knives. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.L.B. dob 3-13-1970, S.T.B. dob 11-1-1968 or RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Michael J Behenna in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman for bond purposes only. Defendant is on PO hold. State is in compliance with victim's rights. Signature bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Arrest
